Use the display font style for large headings or prominent text that requires emphasis. Display is ideal for grabbing the user\'s attention and making a bold statement. Avoid using this style for long texts.

Use the title font style when you need a clear visual hierarchy without overwhelming the layout. You can apply this style in short texts that need to stand out when compared to body text, like section titles, card titles, page titles, etc.
The body font style is ideal for regular text content, such as paragraphs, or descriptions. The body styles are suitable both for long and short text, where readability and legibility are essential.
The action font style is suitable for text elements that represent interactive or actionable items, such as buttons, input, and links. Use it to distinguish interactive elements from regular text.
The caption font style is used for supporting text that provides context and complements visual elements, like icons, images, tags, etc. Avoid using this style in long texts.
Spacing tokens guarantee consistent spacing and alignment between elements while providing better readability, clarity, and balance.

Use the spacing tokens to organize the content under the correct hierarchy.

It's important to group related elements to increase readability.

For related items, use smaller spacing values. While between unrelated items, it's better to increase the spacing.
Border radius tokens are applied to elements with rounded corners, such as buttons, cards, input fields, and containers, to soften their edges and create a more pleasing appearance.
Use Extra small for very subtle rounded corners.
Use Small for the smallest elements or nested components.
The Medium variation is used in most components. Use it in small-to-medium components and containers.
Use Large for medium-to-large components and containers.
Use Extra Large for the biggest elements, especially on tablet screens.
Use Pill for the components that are completely rounded on their sides.
Icons are graphic assets that improve usability by providing extra meaning to actions and components, making them more visually appealing and easier to understand.
When creating new icons, start with a base of 24px and draw the icon using a 1.5px stroke. Use the Icon grid (represented below) to help you design consistent icons.
